tournament.name: Fuguete Champ 272 - Play Point P/ Top 10

decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By deploying efficient and low-cost threats like Clockwork Percussionist and Goblin Tomb Raider, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent. Cards like Galvanic Blast and Lightning Bolt serve both as removal and direct damage to the opponent's life total. The inclusion of Rally at the Hornburg and Wrenn's Resolve allows the deck to maintain tempo and pump up its creatures for a final push to secure victory. Overall, the strategy revolves around fast and relentless attacks to end the game swiftly.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to utilize card draw, counterspells, and removal spells to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By efficiently managing resources and disrupting the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to establish board control and slowly grind out a win through card advantage and powerful threats like Sneaky Snacker and Gurmag Angler. The inclusion of graveyard synergies and cantrips like Thought Scour and Brainstorm help ensure consistency and flexibility in navigating different matchups.

The main idea of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with low-cost creatures and burn spells. By combining aggressive creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Sneaky Snacker with direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper, the deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. Additional cards like Faithless Looting and Grab the Prize provide card advantage and help maintain pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, aiming to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this Pauper 1 vs 1 Rakdos Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to quickly deal damage and finish the game as fast as possible by using low-cost creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Sneaky Snacker. The deck also utilizes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper to eliminate threats and keep the pressure on the opponent. Additionally, card draw and graveyard recursion with Faithless Looting and Sazacap's Brew help maintain card advantage and consistency in the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive strategy centered around the Affinity mechanic. By utilizing low-cost artifacts and creatures like Glint Hawk, Myr Enforcer, and Kor Skyfisher, the deck aims to flood the board with threats while also benefitting from powerful artifacts like Cryogen Relic and Cast Down. The inclusion of cards like Thoughtcast and Grim Bauble help maintain card advantage and consistency, while land base consisting of artifact lands like Vault of Whispers and Seat of the Synod further enhances the deck's synergy and speed.

This aggressive deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through a combination of creature attacks and burn spells. By utilizing low-cost creatures with abilities that trigger damage, along with a full suite of burn spells, the deck aims to lower the opponent's life total as fast as possible. It also includes card draw and mana acceleration to maintain momentum and ensure a steady stream of threats and burn spells throughout the game. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and finish them off with direct damage spells.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on applying continuous pressure on the opponent with low-cost creatures and burn spells. By efficiently using burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper, combined with creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Kitchen Imp, the deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's life total. Additionally, cards like Sazacap's Brew and Faithless Looting help to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on. The deck also includes lifegain options such as Vampire's Kiss and Alms of the Vein to sustain itself while relentlessly attacking the opponent.

This deck focuses on playing small, cheap creatures quickly to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of creatures. It also aims to maintain a board presence and protect its creatures with spells like Prismatic Strands. The deck includes a mix of creatures with various abilities, as well as some removal spells like Journey to Nowhere. The goal is to be aggressive and apply pressure to the opponent while also having some control elements to protect your creatures and disrupt your opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to utilize efficient counterspells and removal spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card draw and filtering to help find key pieces and maintain card advantage. Additionally, it features evasive creatures like Faerie Seer and Ninja of the Deep Hours to pressure the opponent and provide card advantage through their abilities. The inclusion of a few win conditions like Thorn of the Black Rose and Murmuring Mystic ensures the deck can close out the game once it has established control.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy utilizing Elves. By utilizing mana ramp creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, along with powerful Elf synergy cards like Priest of Titania and Timberwatch Elf, the deck aims to quickly build a wide board presence and pump up its creatures with abilities like Timberwatch Elf's to deal massive amounts of damage. Cards like Wellwisher provide some resilience against aggressive opponents, while Lead the Stampede and Winding Way help refill the hand with Elves for continued pressure.

This Pauper 1 vs 1 Golgari/Jund Garden deck focuses on controlling the opponent through a combination of removal spells and creature sacrifice effects. The deck utilizes cards like Crypt Rats and Thorn of the Black Rose to control the board, while also gaining card advantage with Ichor Wellspring and Lembas. The deck includes graveyard hate with Nihil Spellbomb and Bojuka Bog, as well as lifegain with Pulse of Murasa. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently managing resources and disrupting their game plan.

The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures using cards like Stinkweed Imp and Satyr Wayfinder, before utilizing cards like Dread Return and Malevolent Rumble to reanimate powerful creatures like Lotleth Giant. Town Greeter and Circle of the Land Druid help ramp up the mana for these big plays. Momentary Blink provides protection and recursion for key creatures. The deck also includes utility lands like Khalni Garden and Holdout Settlement to fix mana and provide additional value. Overall, the deck focuses on comboing out powerful reanimation plays to overwhelm the opponent.

This Pauper 1 vs 1 deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with cheap artifacts and creatures. By leveraging the affinity mechanic, the deck aims to flood the board with powerful threats like Myr Enforcer and use burn spells like Galvanic Blast to finish off opponents. Utilizing cards like Ichor Wellspring and Thoughtcast for card draw, the deck maintains a steady stream of resources to fuel its aggressive game plan. The inclusion of cards like Krark-Clan Shaman and Nihil Spellbomb helps to disrupt opponents' strategies, while also providing additional value for the deck.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using cheap and efficient creatures like Masked Meower and Sneaky Snacker, as well as direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper. The deck also includes cards like Guttersnipe and Kessig Flamebreather to amplify burn damage. With cards like Fireblast and Chain Lightning, the deck aims to finish off the opponent quickly before they can establish a defense. The deck also includes card advantage and mana ramp with cards like Grab the Prize and Highway Robbery to maintain pressure on the opponent.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly establish board control and pressure opponents with low-cost, efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By leveraging powerful card draw and selection spells like Thought Scour, Brainstorm, and Ponder, along with countermagic in the form of Dispel and Counterspell, the deck aims to maintain tempo and protect its threats. With a low land count and the ability to bounce or tap down opponent's permanents using Boomerang and Sleep of the Dead, this mono blue aggro deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a Pauper 1 vs 1 format.

The Orzhov Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost creatures like Novice Inspector and Spirited Companion, supported by cards like Ephemerate and Inspiring Overseer to pump them up. The deck also includes removal spells like Cast Down and Chainer's Edict to control the opponent's board. The use of Orzhov Basilica and Scoured Barrens helps maintain a steady mana base for consistent aggressive plays. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creature aggression and disruptive spells.
